chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Temporary Restraining Order

result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Mrozak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Temporary Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Apply 2 days sentence credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied.  Balance of cash bail to be refunded to poster.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
No contact whatsoever with the victim listed in the criminal complaint.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Temporary Restraining Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Mrozak

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Christopher  Mrozak in court with attorney Craig S. Powell.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 2.
Counts 1 & 3 are dismissed as read ins.



Court orders the following:
30 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions)
2 Days Credit.
STAYED.

Term of Probation: 6 Months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  victim listed in the criminal complaint by any form.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

COSTS:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge: $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply Bail and Balance to be Refunded to the posting party.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Attorney Craig S. Powell in court.   Defendant Christopher Mrozak did not appear.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Plea and sentencing date previoudly scheduled with Judge Dreyfus' clerk.
Request for adjournment filed by plaintiff.
Preliminary hearing on October 9, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Mary U. and Amanda J. listed in the Criminal Complaint or Mary's residence.

Defendant Christopher Mrozak in court, in custody, with attorney Craig S. Powell.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Powell moves to dismiss count #1.  Atty. Powell to file motion to dismiss.  Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 9, 2015 at 10:00 am.
